eventTips.create: Event triggered when the object is initialized
eventTips.hittrigger: Event triggered when the actor is hit by a trigger
eventTips.hitactor: Event triggered when colliding with the target actor
eventTips.collision: Event triggered when the actor collides with another actor
eventTips.destroy: Event triggered before the object is destroyed
eventTips.playerenter: Event triggered when the player actor enters the area
eventTips.playerleave: Event triggered when the player actor leaves the area
eventTips.actorenter: Event triggered when any actor enters the area
eventTips.actorleave: Event triggered when any actor leaves the area
eventTips.skillcast: Event triggered by the 'Cast Skill' command
eventTips.skilladd: Event triggered when a skill is added to the actor
eventTips.skillremove: Event triggered when a skill is removed from the actor
eventTips.stateadd: Event triggered when a state is added to the actor
eventTips.stateremove: Event triggered when a state is removed from the actor
eventTips.equipmentadd: Event triggered when equipment is added to the actor
eventTips.equipmentremove: Event triggered when equipment is removed from the actor
eventTips.equipmentgain: Event triggered when the actor gains equipment
eventTips.itemuse: Event triggered by the 'Use Item' command
eventTips.itemgain: Event triggered when the actor gains an item
eventTips.moneygain: Event triggered when the actor gains money
eventTips.startup: Game startup event, triggered after preloading is complete
eventTips.createscene: The event automatically called when a scene is loaded for the first time, before 'Load Scene' events; cannot be triggered by loading a save
eventTips.loadscene: The event automatically called after a scene is loaded, before 'Autorun' events; can be triggered repeatedly when loading saves
eventTips.loadsave: The event automatically called after loading a save
eventTips.showtext: A synchronous event automatically called by the 'Show Text' command; waits for completion before continuing the main event, allowing custom dialogue boxes
eventTips.showchoices: A synchronous event automatically called by the 'Show Choices' command; waits for completion before continuing the main event, allowing custom choice interfaces
eventTips.keydown: Event triggered when a key is pressed on the keyboard, key code is obtained through the 'Set String' command
eventTips.keyup: Event triggered when a key is released on the keyboard, key code is obtained through the 'Set String' command
eventTips.mousedown: Event triggered when any mouse button is pressed, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.mousedownLB: Event triggered when the left mouse button is pressed, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.mousedownRB: Event triggered when the right mouse button is pressed, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.mouseup: Event triggered when any mouse button is released, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.mouseupLB: Event triggered when the left mouse button is released, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.mouseupRB: Event triggered when the right mouse button is released, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.mousemove: Event triggered when the mouse is moved
eventTips.mouseenter: Event triggered when the mouse enters the object
eventTips.mouseleave: Event triggered when the mouse leaves the object
eventTips.click: Event triggered when the mouse button is pressed and released
eventTips.doubleclick: Event triggered when the mouse button is pressed twice consecutively, on the second press
eventTips.wheel: Event triggered when the mouse wheel is scrolled, direction of scrolling obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.touchstart:
Event triggered when a finger touches the touchscreen
All simultaneous touch points trigger the event once
Touch point ID is obtained through the 'Traverse' command
Touch point position is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.touchmove:
Event triggered when a finger moves on the touchscreen
All simultaneous touch points trigger the event once
Touch point ID is obtained through the 'Traverse' command
Touch point position is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.touchend:
Event triggered when a finger leaves the touchscreen
All simultaneous touch points trigger the event once
Touch point ID is obtained through the 'Traverse' command
Touch point position is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.select: Event triggered when a button element is selected
eventTips.deselect: Event triggered when a button element is deselected
eventTips.input: Triggered when content is entered in a text box
eventTips.focus:
Event triggered when the text box enters input state
Focus added using the 'Set Focus' command triggers the event
eventTips.blur:
Event triggered when the text box exits input state
Focus removed using the 'Set Focus' command triggers the event
eventTips.ended: Event triggered when the animation or video element finishes playing
eventTips.gamepadbuttonpress: Event triggered when a gamepad button is pressed, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.gamepadbuttonrelease: Event triggered when a gamepad button is released, button code is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.gamepadleftstickchange: Event triggered when the left gamepad stick changes, stick angle is obtained through the 'Set Number' command
eventTips.gamepadrightstickchange: Event triggered when the right gamepad stick changes, stick angle is obtained through the 'Set Number' command

command.showText.desc:
Call the preset event to obtain the parameters and content of this command
You can create a dialog box and load the content through that event
command.showChoices.desc:
Call the preset event to obtain the parameters and content of this command
You can create a choice window and load the content through that event
command.comment.desc: Some text used to explain and illustrate
command.setBoolean.desc: Write a boolean to a boolean type or non-existent variable
command.setNumber.desc: Write a number to a numeric type or non-existent variable
command.setString.desc: Write a string to a string type or non-existent variable
command.setObject.desc: Write an object to an object type or non-existent variable
command.setList.desc: Create a list and write to an object type or non-existent variable, or modify a list read from a variable
command.deleteVariable.desc: Delete a variable that is no longer needed
command.if.desc:
Control the flow by checking conditions.
Enter the first branch that meets the condition.
A branch can have multiple conditions.
command.switch.desc:
Control the flow by checking conditions.
If the variable is one of the values listed in the branch, enter the branch.
command.loop.desc:
A block of commands that will be executed repeatedly when the condition is met.
If the logic is flawed, it may enter an infinite loop, causing the game program to become unresponsive.
command.forEach.desc: Fetch data one by one and assign it to the variable, execute the commands in the block each time it is acquired.
command.break.desc: Break out of the "Loop" or "For Each" command block
command.continue.desc: Jump to the next round of "Loop" or "For Each"
command.independent.desc:
Separate the commands within the block for asynchronous execution (shared event variables).
Even if the host object of the event is destroyed, the commands within the block will continue to execute.
It is advised not to rely on it, as placing loop logic inside may cause continuous computation in the background.
Warning: The 'Reset' command will not stop the execution of commands within the 'Independent' block.
command.callEvent.desc: Trigger a global event or a specified object event.
command.callEvent.return.tip: Accept a return value from the called event and write it to this variable.
command.return.desc: Ends the current event. If it's a global event and a return type is specified, the return value can be passed to other events that called it.
command.stopEvent.desc: End the events currently being executed by various objects.
command.registerEvent.desc:
Register or unregister a temporary event
The registered event shares local variables with the current event
The same event will not be registered multiple times
command.setEvent.desc: Set the event currently being executed or a global event.
command.transition.desc: Calculate interpolation each frame during the transition period and execute the commands within the block.
command.block.desc: Stores commands in a block for easier folding and management, with the option to start a new execution branch.
command.label: Label
command.label.desc: Set a label at the current position for jumping, without executing any actual content.
command.jumpTo.desc: Jump to the specified location and continue execution.
command.wait.desc: Wait for a period of time before continuing to execute the subsequent commands.
command.setImage.desc: Set the built-in properties of the image element.
command.loadImage.desc: Load a specific image into the element.
command.tintImage.desc: Set the tint of the image element.
command.setText.desc: Set the built-in properties of the text element.
command.setTextBox.desc: Set the built-in properties of the text box element.
command.setDialogBox.desc: 设置对话框元素的内置属性
command.controlDialog.desc: Call the built-in methods of the dialog element.
command.setProgressBar.desc: Set the built-in properties of the progress bar element.
command.setButton.desc: Set the built-in properties of the button element.
command.controlButton.desc: Call the built-in methods of the button element.
command.setAnimation.desc: Set the built-in properties of the animation element.
command.setVideo.desc: Set the built-in properties of the video element.
command.setWindow.desc: Set the built-in properties of the window element.
command.waitForVideo.desc: Wait for the video element to finish playing before continuing to execute the subsequent commands.
command.setElement.desc: Call the built-in methods of any element.
command.nestElement.desc: Make the element a child of another element.
command.moveElement.desc: Set the transform properties of any element.
command.deleteElement.desc: Destroy the specified element. The destroyed element will no longer execute its associated events.
command.setPointerEventRoot.desc: Set the root element, so that only pointer events for this element and its descendants will be triggered, blocking pointer events for other elements.
command.setFocus.desc: After setting the focus element, you can control its descendant buttons with shortcuts and trigger the 'focus' event.
command.createObject.desc: Create a preset object in the scene at a specified position.
command.moveLight.desc: Move the light source object to a specified position and set its built-in properties.
command.deleteObject.desc: Destroy the specified scene object. The destroyed object will no longer execute events.
command.setState.desc: Set the time for the state. The state will be removed when the countdown reaches 0.
command.playAnimation.desc: Create an animation object, which will be automatically destroyed once it finishes playing.
command.setObjectAnimation.desc: Temporarily change the visual properties of an object's animation
command.playAudio.desc: Play background music, ambient sounds, sound effects, etc.
command.stopAudio.desc: Immediately stop playing the specified type of sound.
command.setVolume.desc: Adjust the volume of the sound.
command.setPan.desc: Adjust the left-right channel volume of the sound.
command.setReverb.desc: Simulate the echo in enclosed spaces (such as sewers, caves, halls) to enhance the environmental atmosphere.
command.setLoop.desc: Toggle the looping mode of the sound.
command.saveAudio.desc: Save the current playback time of the audio.
command.restoreAudio.desc: Restore the last saved playback time and continue playing.
command.createActor.desc: Create a new actor at a specified position in the scene.
command.moveActor.desc: Control the movement behavior of an actor.
command.followActor.desc: Make an actor automatically follow another actor.
command.translateActor.desc: Move the actor a certain distance in a specified direction. This can be used for displacement skills, knockback effects, attraction effects, etc.
command.changeThreat.desc: Change the actor's threat level towards a target (a built-in property used to filter target actors).
command.setWeight.desc: A built-in property of the actor that affects collision behavior.
command.setMovementSpeed.desc: A built-in property of the actor that affects movement speed.
command.setAngle.desc: A built-in property of the actor that affects the direction of animation motions.
command.fixAngle.desc: Toggle the lock status of the actor's angle.
command.setActive.desc: Toggle the activation status of the actor. When deactivated, all the actor's events are paused.
command.getActor.desc: Get an actor near a specified position in the scene.
command.getMultipleActors.desc: Get multiple actors near a specified position in the scene.
command.deleteActor.desc: Delete an actor from the scene. If it's a global actor, it will be removed and placed in the background.
command.setPlayerActor.desc: After being set as the player actor, it can be accessed via the actor accessor (player actor).
command.setPartyMember.desc: Add or remove a party member. Must be a global actor.
command.changePassableTerrain.desc: Change the passable terrain for a specified actor.
command.changeActorTeam.desc: Simultaneously change the relationships between the actor and other actors.
command.changeActorState.desc: Call the built-in methods of the actor's state manager.
command.changeActorEquipment.desc: Call the built-in methods of the actor's equipment manager.
command.changeActorSkill.desc: Call the built-in methods of the actor's skill manager.
command.changeActorPortrait.desc: Change the actor's appearance or expression.
command.changeActorAnimation.desc: Replace the actor's animation with a new one.
command.changeActorSprite.desc: Replace a sprite texture in the actor's animation.
command.changeActorMotion.desc: Set the animation motion corresponding to the actor's special behavior.
command.playActorAnimation.desc: Play an animation motion from the actor's animation, and return to the default motion after it finishes.
command.stopActorAnimation.desc: Immediately stop the current animation motion, and return to the default motion.
command.addAnimationComponent.desc: Add an extra animation component to the actor.
command.setAnimationComponent.desc: Set the built-in properties of the animation component bound to the actor.
command.removeAnimationComponent.desc: Remove the component specified animation and motion from the actor's animation component list.
command.createGlobalActor.desc: The global actor's data will be saved in the game save file.
command.transferGlobalActor.desc: Transfer the global actor to a specified position in the current scene. If the actor already exists, the command will have no effect.
command.deleteGlobalActor.desc: Completely delete the global actor when it is no longer needed.
command.setTarget.desc: Set the specified actor as the 'Target Actor' in the actor accessor
command.getTarget.desc: Select a valid actor from the target pool of a specified actor, and assign it to the actor accessor's 'target actor'.
command.appendTarget.desc: Add an actor to the actor's target pool.
command.removeTarget.desc: Remove an actor from the actor's target pool.
command.detectTargets.desc: Search for nearby target actors that meet the conditions and add them to the target actor pool.
command.discardTargets.desc: Discard some actors from the actor's target pool.
command.resetTargets.desc: Remove all actors from the actor's target pool.
command.renderOutline.desc: Render the outline of the actor animation sprite.
command.castSkill.desc:
Triggers the 'Cast Skill' event.
If the skill does not exist or is on cooldown, the command will not be executed.
The 'Cast Skill' event will inherit the 'Target Actor' from the current event actor accessor.
command.setSkill.desc: Increase or decrease the skill's cooldown time.
command.createTrigger.desc:
Create a trigger, typically used in skills, to capture actors and trigger the 'Hit Event'
All events of the trigger will inherit the 'Target Actor' from the current event actor accessor.
command.setTriggerSpeed.desc: Trigger's built-in property that affects the speed of movement.
command.setTriggerAngle.desc: Trigger's built-in property that affects the movement angle and animation motion direction.
command.setTriggerDuration.desc: Trigger's built-in property that automatically destroys the trigger after the timeout.
command.setTriggerMotion.desc: Change the animation motion of the trigger.
command.setInventory.desc: Invoke the built-in methods of the actor's inventory.
command.setItem.desc: Increase or decrease the quantity of an item. The item will be removed from the inventory when the quantity reaches 0.
command.setCooldown.desc: Set the cooldown time for the corresponding cooldown key, which will automatically count down in the background.
command.setShortcut.desc: Add an item or skill to the shortcut bar, or remove a specific shortcut slot.
command.activateScene.desc: Switch between the main scene and the background scene.
command.loadScene.desc: Destroy the current scene and load a new one.
command.loadSubscene.desc: Load all objects from the specified subscene into the current scene.
command.unloadSubscene.desc: Unload all objects related to the subscene.
command.clampCamera.desc: Forces the camera to view only within a rectangular area, preventing the display of scenes outside the rectangle.
command.unclampCamera.desc: Removes the restriction on the camera's visible area.
command.moveCamera.desc: The camera position affects the visible area of the scene.
command.setZoomFactor.desc: The zoom factor for scene objects.
command.setAmbientLight.desc: Change the ambient light of the current scene.
command.tintScreen.desc: Change the tone of the scene's visuals.
command.shakeScreen.desc: Temporarily shake the camera to create a vibration visual effect.
command.setTile.desc: Replace a tile at a specific location in a tilemap.
command.deleteTile.desc: Remove a tile at a specific location in a tilemap.
command.setTerrain.desc: Change the terrain at a specified location.
command.setGameSpeed.desc: Affect the game speed by scaling the 'Delta Time', allowing for time to be paused.
command.setTeamRelation.desc: Change the relationship between two teams, either as enemies or allies.
command.switchCollisionSystem.desc: Toggle the built-in actor or scene collision system.
command.gameData.desc: Save, load, or delete game data.
command.reset.desc: Reset all game data to its initial state.
command.pauseGame.desc: Prevent scene pointer events from being triggered.
command.preventSceneInput.desc: Block scene pointer events from being triggered.
command.restoreSceneInput.desc: Allow scene pointer events to be triggered.
command.simulateKey.desc: Force the triggering of keyboard events.
command.setLanguage.desc: Switch the localization language and refresh the text content.
command.setResolution.desc: Change the canvas size, scene scaling factor, and UI scaling factor.

confirmation.compileError: An error occurred while compiling, Continue?
confirmation.guidConflict:
The following files have duplicate GUIDs (16-character identifiers) and cannot be referenced correctly.
Please ensure GUID uniqueness by deleting or renaming unused files.
confirmation.oversizeImage: The following images exceed the size limit of <size> and cannot be properly processed into textures.
confirmation.importLanguagePack:
Import the contents of the "<filename>" file to the "<langname>" language pack.
The action cannot be undone.
confirmation.versionIsTooHigh: The project version is higher than the editor version and cannot be opened.

[easing].label: Easing
[easing].tip: The transition method of interpolation calculation.

[duration].label: Duration
[duration].tip: The interpolation is calculated once per frame during the transition.

[wait].label: Wait
[wait].tip: Whether to wait for the command to complete execution.

true.name: Yes
true.tip: Wait for the related content to finish before executing the next event commands.

false.name: No
false.tip: Immediately execute the next event commands.

title-play.tip:
$Run Game
F10：Show Stats/FPS
F11：Toggle Fullscreen
F12：Developer Tools

scene-switch-light.tip:
$Light
Render ambient light and light sources

scene-layer-object.tip:
$Object Layer
Scene objects can be selected in this mode

scene-layer-terrain.tip:
$Terrain Layer
Set the obstacle area
Land: Actors with "land" or "unrestricted" passage terrain can move here
Water: Actors with "water" or "unrestricted" passage terrain can move here
Wall: Actors with "unrestricted" passage terrain can move here, it can block "trigger" objects from passing through

scene-brush-eraser.tip:
$Eraser
Erase a tile in the tilemap

scene-brush-pencil.tip:
$Pencil
Draw the selected tiles into the tilemap

scene-brush-rect.tip:
$Rectangle
Fill the selected tiles into the rectangular area by dragging

scene-brush-oval.tip:
$Oval
Fill the selected tiles into the oval area by dragging

scene-brush-fill.tip:
$Fill
Fill the selected tiles into the consecutive and identical tiles of the tilemap

ui-element-textbox.tip:
$Text Box
Create a text box element

ui-element-dialogbox.tip:
$Dialog Box
Create a dialog box element

ui-element-progressbar.tip:
$Progress Bar
Create a progress bar element

animation-switch-onionskin.tip:
$Onionskin
Display semi-transparent sprites for the previous and next frames of the current frame

animation-switch-mirror.tip:
$Mirror
Flip the animation horizontally with the Y axis as the axis of symmetry

animation-speed.tip:
$Playback Speed
The speed of playing animation on the stage
1: Normal playback speed
4: 4 times playback speed

animation-timeline-previousKey.tip:
$Previous Key Frame
Jump to the previous keyframe of the current frame

animation-timeline-previous.tip:
$Previous Frame
Jump to the previous frame of the current frame

animation-timeline-play.tip:
$Play/Pause
If the animation is paused, play the animation, otherwise pause the animation

animation-timeline-next.tip:
$Next Frame
Jump to the next frame of the current frame

animation-timeline-nextKey.tip:
$Next Key Frame
Jump to the next keyframe of the current frame

animation-timeline-loop.tip:
$Loop
When the animation ends, jump to the first frame and continue playing (only effective in the editor)

particle-view-wireframe.tip:
$Wireframe
Render the wireframe of the particle element

particle-view-anchor.tip:
$Anchor
Render the anchor point of the particle element (red cross), and the line from the anchor point to the center of the particle (green line)

particle-speed.tip:
$Playback Speed
The speed of playing particle animation on the stage
1: Normal playback speed
4: 4 times playback speed

fileScene-width.label: Width
fileScene-width.tip: The number of horizontal grids for the scene (0 ~ 512)

fileScene-height.label: Height
fileScene-height.tip: The number of vertical grids for the scene (0 ~ 512)

fileScene-tileWidth.label: Tile Width
fileScene-tileWidth.tip: The width of the scene grid (16 ~ 256)

fileScene-tileHeight.label: Tile Height
fileScene-tileHeight.tip: The height of the scene grid (16 ~ 256)

fileScene-ambient-red-box.label: Red
fileScene-ambient-red-box.tip: Input Color (red) * Ambient Light (red) / 255 = Output Color (red)

fileScene-ambient-green-box.label: Green
fileScene-ambient-green-box.tip: Input color (green) * Ambient Light (green) / 255 = Output Color (green)

fileScene-ambient-blue-box.label: Blue
fileScene-ambient-blue-box.tip: Input color (blue) * Ambient Light (blue) / 255 = Output Color (blue)

fileScene-ambient-direct-box.label: Direct Light Ratio
fileScene-ambient-direct-box.tip: The color of the direct light will be rendered directly on the screen

fileScene-events.label: Events
fileScene-events.tip:
A list of scene events that will stop execution when the scene is destroyed
$Optional types
Create: Triggered at scene initialization (once)
Autorun: Triggered when the scene is loaded (including after loading savedata)

fileScene-scripts.label: Scripts
fileScene-scripts.tip: Add script files to extend this scene

fileUI-width.label: Width
fileUI-width.tip: The width of the UI stage container, which is only used for preview

fileUI-height.label: Height
fileUI-height.tip: The height of the UI stage container, which is only used for preview

fileAnimation-sprites.label: Sprites
fileAnimation-sprites.tip: Set the spritesheets of this animation for use in sprite layers

palette-scroll.tip:
$Vertical Scroll Mode
On: Slide the mouse wheel to scroll up and down the tileset
Off: Slide the mouse wheel to zoom in and out the tileset

palette-priority.tip:
$Priority
The sorting priority of tiles when rendering on the object layer.
Tiles positioned below will always overlay tiles above.
Priority = -1, which means that the sorting position is shifted up by a distance of one tile
Priority = 1, which means that the sorting position is shifted down by a distance of one tile

palette-terrain.tip:
$Terrain
Land: Actors with "land" or "unrestricted" passage terrain can move here
Water: Actors with "water" or "unrestricted" passage terrain can move here
Wall: Actors with "unrestricted" passage terrain can move here, it can also prevent triggers from passing

palette-edit.tip:
$Edit Auto Tiles
If a file of auto tile is open, switch to edit mode and enable the context menu for tiles

palette-flip.tip:
$Flip normal tiles
Flip selected normal tiles horizontally (does not change auto tiles)

fileTileset-image.label: Image
fileTileset-image.tip: The sprite image for normal tiles

fileTileset-width.label: Width
fileTileset-width.tip: The number of horizontal tiles in the tileset (1 ~ 256)

fileTileset-height.label: Height
fileTileset-height.tip: The number of vertical tiles in the tileset (1 ~ 256)

fileTileset-tileWidth.label: Tile Width
fileTileset-tileWidth.tip: The number of horizontal pixels in a single tile (16 ~ 256)

fileTileset-tileHeight.label: Tile Height
fileTileset-tileHeight.tip: The number of vertical pixels in a single tile (16 ~ 256)

fileTileset-globalOffsetX.label: Tile Offset X
fileTileset-globalOffsetX.tip: The horizontal position offset of tiles drawn on the scene

fileTileset-globalOffsetY.label: Tile Offset Y
fileTileset-globalOffsetY.tip: The vertical position offset of tiles drawn on the scene

fileTileset-globalPriority.label: Tile Priority
fileTileset-globalPriority.tip:
The sorting priority of tiles when rendering on the object layer.
Tiles positioned below will always overlay tiles above.
Priority = -1, which means that the sorting position is shifted up by a distance of one tile
Priority = 1, which means that the sorting position is shifted down by a distance of one tile

fileActor-portrait.label: Portrait
fileActor-portrait.tip:
The initial actor portrait
$Related commands
Change Actor Portrait, Load Image

fileActor-clip.label: Clip
fileActor-clip.tip:
The clip area of ​the portrait
$Related commands
Change Actor Portrait, Load Image

fileActor-animationId.label: Animation
fileActor-animationId.tip:
The initial actor animation
$Related command
Change Actor Animation

fileActor-idleMotion.label: Idle Motion
fileActor-idleMotion.tip:
The animation motion that plays automatically when the actor is idle
$Related command
Change Actor Motion

fileActor-moveMotion.label: Move Motion
fileActor-moveMotion.tip:
The animation motion that plays automatically when the actor is moving
$Related command
Change Actor Motion

fileActor-rotatable.label: Rotatable
fileActor-rotatable.tip: Whether to automatically update the animation rotation angle

true.name: Yes
true.tip: The animation rotates due to its angle

false.name: No
false.tip: The animation never rotates

fileActor-passage.label: Passable Terrain
fileActor-passage.tip:
The initial passable terrain
$Related command
Change Passable Terrain

land.name: Land
land.tip: The actor can only move on land

water.name: Water
water.tip: The actor can only move in water

unrestricted.name: Unrestricted
unrestricted.tip: The actor can move on land, in water, in walls

fileActor-speed.label: Movement Speed
fileActor-speed.tip:
The initial movement speed (unit: tiles/second)
$Related command
Set Movement Speed

square.name: Square
square.tip: A square centered on the actor's location

circle.name: Circle
circle.tip: A circle centered on the actor's location

fileActor-size.label: Collision Size
fileActor-size.tip:
If the shape is a square, this refers to its side length (unit: tiles).
If the shape is a circle, this refers to its diameter (unit: tiles).

fileActor-weight.label: Collision Weight
fileActor-weight.tip:
Affects the pushing force in actor collisions.
Weight = 0: This actor will not collide with others.
If Actor A's weight : Actor B's weight = 1 : 1, A pushes B at 50% of its movement speed.
If Actor A's weight : Actor B's weight = 1 : 2, A cannot push B at all (0% movement).
If Actor A's weight : Actor B's weight = 2 : 1, A pushes B at full speed (100%) with no resistance.
$Related Command: Set Weight

fileActor-immovable.label: Immovable
fileActor-immovable.tip: Determines whether this actor can be pushed by others during a collision.

true.name: Yes
true.tip: This actor cannot be pushed during collisions.

false.name: No
false.tip: This actor's push distance will be calculated based on its weight.

fileActor-priority.label: Priority
fileActor-priority.tip:
Determines the rendering order of actor animations.
Animations positioned lower will always cover those above.
Priority = -1: The rendering position shifts up by one tile.
Priority = 1: The rendering position shifts down by one tile.

fileActor-inherit.label: Inherit
fileActor-inherit.tip:
Inherits specified actor's attributes, skills, equipments, inventory, events, and scripts
If the same attribute exists, it overrides the inherited actor's attribute value
If the same type of event exists, it overrides the inherited actor's event
Overridden events can still be triggered using the 'Call Event' command
However, inherited scripts will stack instead of being overridden

fileActor-sprites.label: Sprites
fileActor-sprites.tip:
The replaced spritesheets of the actor animation
$Related command
Change Actor Sprite

fileActor-attributes.label: Attributes
fileActor-attributes.tip:
The initial attribute list
$Optional types
Boolean, Number, String, Enumeration(String)
$Related commands
Set Boolean, Set Number, Set String

fileActor-skills.label: Skills
fileActor-skills.tip:
The initial skill list
$Related commands
Change Actor Skill, Cast Skill

fileActor-equipments.label: Equipments
fileActor-equipments.tip:
The initial equipment list
$Related command
Change Actor Equipment

fileActor-inventory.label: Inventory
fileActor-inventory.tip:
The initial inventory list
$Related command
Set Inventory

fileActor-events.label: Events
fileActor-events.tip:
A list of actor events

penetrate-destroy.tip: The trigger is destroyed after hitting actors times

circle.name: Circle
circle.tip: A circle with the trigger as the center and a specified radius

sector.name: Sector
sector.tip: A sector with the trigger as the center and a specified radius and central angle

fileTrigger-shape-width.label: Width
fileTrigger-shape-width.tip: The horizontal length of the trigger shape when the trigger is facing the right (0 degrees)

fileTrigger-shape-height.label: Height
fileTrigger-shape-height.tip: The vertical length of the trigger shape when the trigger is facing the right (0 degrees)

fileTrigger-shape-anchor.label: Anchor
fileTrigger-shape-anchor.tip:
The horizontal position of the connection point between the trigger and the scene when the trigger is facing the right (0 degrees)
0 = Left
0.5 = Center
1 = Right

fileTrigger-shape-radius.label: Radius
fileTrigger-shape-radius.tip: The radius of the trigger shape

fileTrigger-speed.label: Speed
fileTrigger-speed.tip: The initial movement speed of the trigger (unit: tiles/second)

fileTrigger-hitMode.label: Hit Mode
fileTrigger-hitMode.tip: How often the trigger collides with an actor

once-on-overlap.name: Once On Overlap
once-on-overlap.tip:
Only hit an actor once when he overlaps the trigger
The actor can be hit again after being separated from the trigger

repeat.name: Repeat
repeat.tip: Hit an actor multiple times, and the interval time can be specified

fileTrigger-hitInterval.label: Hit Interval
fileTrigger-hitInterval.tip: The time between multiple hits on the same actor

fileTrigger-initialDelay.label: Initial Delay
fileTrigger-initialDelay.tip: The trigger is delayed to activate, and then it can hit actors

fileTrigger-effectiveTime.label: Effective Time
fileTrigger-effectiveTime.tip:
The duration of the trigger activation state. Once it times out, it will no longer hit an actor
If set to 0, it means permanent activation

fileTrigger-duration.label: Duration
fileTrigger-duration.tip:
The time the trigger exists, it will be destroyed after timeout
If set to 0, it means using the duration of the trigger animation. So the trigger will be destroyed when the animation ends

fileTrigger-inherit.label: Inherit
fileTrigger-inherit.tip:
Inherits specified trigger's events and scripts
If the same type of event exists, it overrides the inherited trigger's event
Overridden events can still be triggered using the 'Call Event' command
However, inherited scripts will stack instead of being overridden

fileTrigger-motion.label: Motion
fileTrigger-motion.tip: Select a motion of the trigger animation

fileTrigger-priority.label: Priority
fileTrigger-priority.tip:
The sorting priority of the trigger animation when rendering
The animation positioned below will always overlay the animation above
Priority = -1: The rendering position is shifted up by one tile distance
Priority = 1: The rendering position is shifted down by one tile distance

fileTrigger-offsetY.label: Offset Y
fileTrigger-offsetY.tip: The vertical position offset of the trigger animation (unit: pixels)

fileTrigger-rotatable.label: Rotatable
fileTrigger-rotatable.tip: Whether to automatically update the animation rotation angle

true.name: Yes
true.tip: The animation rotates due to its angle

false.name: No
false.tip: The animation never rotates

uiElement-events.label: Events
uiElement-events.tip:
$Element Events
Visit"Event Triggered Light"to set the Element
$Options
Create: Event triggers when Element is initialized (executed once)
Autorun: Event triggers as soon as the Element appears (including after reading save data)
Mouse Down LB：Event triggers when left mouse button is pressed
Mouse Down RB：Event triggers when right mouse button is pressed
Mouse Down：Event triggers when ANY mouse button is pressed
Mouse Up LB: Event triggers when left mouse button is released
Mouse Up RB： Event triggers when right mouse button is released
Mouse Up: Event triggers when ANY mouse button is released
Mouse Move: Event triggers when mouse moves within an Element
Mouse Enter: Event triggers when mouse enters an Element
Mouse Leave: Event triggers when mouse leaves an Element
Click: Event triggers when the mouse is clicked and released
Double Click: Event triggers when the mouse is clicked & released twice, triggering on the second release
Wheel: Event triggers when the mouse wheel is moved
Key Down: Event is triggered when a button Element is selected
Key Up: Event is triggered when a button Element is deselected
Input: Event triggers when when something is entered in a text box Element
Focus: Event is triggered when a text box enters the input state, or through a 'Set Focus' event command
Blur: Event triggers when a text box exits the input state, or through a 'Set Focus' event command
Event triggers just as (before) an Element is destroyed
Gamepad Button Press: Event triggers when a gamepad button is pressed 
Gamepad Button Release: Event triggers when a gamepad button is released
Left Stick Change: Event triggers when the left stick of the gamepad changes (moves)
Right Stick Change: Event triggers when the right stick of the gamepad changes (moves)
Custom: triggered using the 'Call Event' command

Pressing this key alone moves the axis point upward
Y = -1, Angle = 270

config-virtualAxis-down.label: Axis Down
config-virtualAxis-down.tip:
Pressing this key alone moves the axis point downward
Y = 1, Angle = 90

config-virtualAxis-left.label: Axis Left
config-virtualAxis-left.tip:
Pressing this key alone moves the axis point left
X = -1, Angle = 180

config-virtualAxis-right.label: Axis Right

config-collision-actor-enabled.label: Actor Collision
config-collision-actor-enabled.tip: enable or disable the collision system for actors

true.name: Enabled
true.tip: Automatically separate scene actors based on their collision sizes

false.name: Disabled
false.tip: Turn off the collision system for better performance

config-collision-scene-enabled.label: Scene Collision
config-collision-scene-enabled.tip: Enable or disable the collision system between actors and the scene

true.name: Enabled
true.tip: Actors cannot pass through impassable terrain areas

false.name: Disabled
false.tip: Turn off the collision system for better performance

config-collision-scene-actorSize.label: Scene Collision Actor Size
config-collision-scene-actorSize.tip: When colliding with the scene, the actor is treated as a sphere with this diameter as its collision size

config-collision-trigger-collideWithActo.label: Trigger Collision Mode
config-collision-trigger-collideWithActo.tip: Select the collision detection mode for triggers with actors

true.name: Collide With Actor Shape
true.tip:
The collision is detected when the actor's shape overlaps with the trigger's shape.
More accurate collision detection

false.name: Collide With Actor Anchor
false.tip:
The collision is detected when the actor's anchor point is inside the trigger's shape.
Better performance

config-text-importedFonts.label: Imported Fonts
config-text-importedFonts.tip:
Import external fonts. The font name is the filename (without the extension).
Importing too many fonts will extend initial loading time

config-text-fontFamily.label: Default Font Family
config-text-fontFamily.tip:
The default font used for text, textbox, and dialogbox elements
If multiple fonts are specified, separate them with commas, ordered from left to right in priority

config-text-highDefinition.label: High Definition
config-text-highDefinition.tip: Whether to render high-definition text textures

true.name: Yes
true.tip: Render larger text textures, text remains sharp when scaled or rotated, but consumes more GPU memory

false.name: No
false.tip: Render normal-sized text textures, text may appear blurry when scaled or rotated, but has better GPU performance

config-actor-tempAttributes.label: Actor Temporary Attributes
config-actor-tempAttributes.tip: All actors automatically add preset temporary attributes when initialized. These attributes cannot be saved and will be reset after loading a saved game

config-animation-frameRate.label: Frame Rate
config-animation-frameRate.tip: The number of animation timeline frames played per second. The actual rendered animation frames are interpolated based on FPS

config-soundAttenuation-distance.label: Attenuation Distance
config-soundAttenuation-distance.tip:
When playing 'Attenuated sound effects',
If the camera center is at the sound effect position, the volume is 1.
When the camera center is at or beyond the attenuation distance from the sound effect, the volume is 0

config-soundAttenuation-easingId.label: Attenuation Easing
config-soundAttenuation-easingId.tip: The interpolation curve from volume 1 to volume 0

true.name: Enable
true.tip:
Reduces input latency and improves interaction responsiveness, but may cause slight screen tearing.
May crash when running in fullscreen on some AMD hardware PCs.

false.name: Disable
false.tip: Uses standard synchronized rendering, slightly increasing input latency but providing a more stable display.

config-webgl-textureMagFilter.label: Texture Magnification
config-webgl-textureMagFilter.tip: WebGL texture magnification sampling interpolation algorithm

nearest.name: Nearest Sampling
nearest.tip:
Selects the nearest pixel color directly without interpolation.
The texture appears pixelated, suitable for pixel art or low-resolution retro games.

linear.name: Linear Sampling
linear.tip:
Uses bilinear interpolation to compute pixel values, making textures smoother when scaled.
Textures appear softer and smoother without noticeable pixelation, suitable for high-resolution or realistic-style games.

config-webgl-textureMinFilter.label: Texture Minification
config-webgl-textureMinFilter.tip: WebGL texture minification sampling interpolation algorithm

nearest.name: Nearest Sampling
nearest.tip:
Selects the nearest pixel color directly without interpolation.
The texture appears pixelated, suitable for pixel art or low-resolution retro games.

linear.name: Linear Sampling
linear.tip:
Uses bilinear interpolation to compute pixel values, making textures smoother when scaled.
Textures appear softer and smoother without noticeable pixelation, suitable for high-resolution or realistic-style games.

config-script-autoCompile.label: Auto Compile
config-script-autoCompile.tip: Enable or disable automatic compilation of script files in the background.

true.name: Enable
true.tip: Watch TypeScript files in the project and automatically compile them into JavaScript.

false.name: Disable
false.tip: Disable automatic compilation and use the code editor's compilation feature instead.

config-save-location.label: Save Location
config-save-location.tip: The parent directory where game save data is stored.

app-data.name: User Data Directory
app-data.tip:
This directory is the user's application data folder on different platforms.
Windows: C:\Users\UserName\AppData\Roaming\
macOS: /Users/UserName/Library/Application Support/
Linux: /home/UserName/.config/

documents.name: User Documents Directory
documents.tip:
If you want saves to be stored in the 'Documents' folder, making it easily accessible to users.
Windows: C:\Users\UserName\Documents\
macOS: /Users/UserName/Documents/
Linux: /home/UserName/Documents/

local.name: Application Local Directory
local.tip:
Saves are stored in the local directory, making it easier to inspect save data during development.
However, there is a risk of accidental overwrites when updating the application.

config-save-subdir.label: Subdirectory
config-save-subdir.tip: Relative to the save location, setting a unique directory name can prevent conflicts with other applications' data.

config-localization-languages.label: Languages
config-localization-languages.tip: List of game localization languages, detailed content can be edited in the 'Localization' window

config-localization-default.label: Default Game Language
config-localization-default.tip: The language selected when entering the game. When the game is deployed and the language changes, it will be automatically saved

config-preload.label: Preload Files
config-preload.tip: Whether to preload media files when starting the game

never.name: Never
never.tip: Starts the game quickly, loading image and audio files on demand.

always.name: Always
always.tip: Preloads media files into memory to prevent flickering when displaying images for the first time and to reduce audio playback delay.

deployed.name: Only After Deployment
deployed.tip: Disabled during debugging, enabled only after deployment.

easing-mode.label: Mode
easing-mode.tip: Select the number of curve control points

easing-preview-reverse.label: Reverse

true.name: ON
true.tip: Reverse the animation at the end

false.name: OFF
false.tip: Replay the animation from the beginning

easing-preview-duration.label: Duration
easing-preview-duration.tip: The duration of the transition during preview

easing-preview-delay.label: Wait
easing-preview-delay.tip: The wait time after the transition ends

Certain specific actions will automatically trigger related types of events

local.tip: Temporary variable stored in the event, destroyed when the event ends

global.name: Global
global.tip: User-defined variable, permanently stored in the game save file

self.name: Self Variable
self.tip: Property owned only by preset objects in the scene, permanently stored in the game save file

actor.name: Actor Attribute
actor.tip: Customizable actor properties, editable in the 'Object Attribute' Manager [F6]

skill.name: Skill Attribute
skill.tip: Customizable skill properties, editable in the 'Object Attribute' Manager [F6]

state.tip: Customizable state properties, editable in the 'Object Attribute' Manager [F6]

element.name: Element Attribute
element.tip: Customizable element properties, editable in the 'Object Attribute' Manager [F6], supports object types

trigger.name: Event Trigger Actor
trigger.tip:
The actor that triggered this event, it may be:
The actor who owns this event
The actor who used the item
The actor who added the equipment
The actor who cast the skill
The actor who got the state

caster.name: Skill Caster
caster.tip: Accessible in the 'Cast Skill' event, as well as in trigger and state events

latest.name: Latest Actor
latest.tip: Get the latest created actor, which refreshes when the 'Create Actor' or 'Create Global Actor' command is called

target.name: Target Actor
target.tip:
A temporary container for storing an actor.
In an actor 'Collision' event, it refers to the other actor that collided with the 'Trigger Actor'.
When executing the 'Set Target' command, the specified actor is set as the target actor.
When executing the 'Detect Targets' command, a qualifying actor is retrieved from the actor's target pool as the target actor, which may not always exist.
When executing the 'Show Text' command, it is set to the actor obtained from the 'Actor Accessor' in the command, which may not always exist.

player.name: Player Actor
player.tip: Set the initial player actor via 'Project Settings -> Actor -> Player Actor'. Replace the current player actor via 'Set Player Actor' command

member.name: Party Member
member.tip: Get the actor in the player's party

global.name: Global Actor
global.tip: Get the existing global actor by actor file id

variable.name: Variable
variable.tip: Get the actor from the specified variable

actorGetter-presetId.label: Data ID

skillGetter-variable.label: Variable

callEvent-type.tip: Which event do you want to call

global.name: Global
global.tip:
Synchronously call the specified global event
Execution will wait for the called event to finish before proceeding
Parameters can be passed and return values can be received

inherited.name: Inherited
inherited.tip:
Synchronously call the same type of event of the object being overridden during execution of this event.
If A inherits B, B inherits C, and they all have the same 'XX' event, only A's event is triggered.
Executing 'Call Inherited Event' in A will call B's event,
executing in B will call C's event,
if B lacks the event, A will directly call C's event.
Inheritance chain:
A's registered event > A's scene event > A's event > B's event > C's event...

The newly registered actor event will overwrite the existing event of the same type

followActor-actor.label: Actor
followActor-actor.tip: Make this actor follow the target actor

circle.tip: Actor A follows Actor B within a circle

rectangle.name: Rectangle
rectangle.tip: Actor A follows Actor B within a rectangle

followActor-minDist.label: Min Distance
followActor-minDist.tip:
Circle mode: When the distance is less than the minimum distance, actor A will move away from actor B
Rectangle mode: When the horizontal distance is less than the minimum distance, actor A will move away from actor B

followActor-maxDist.label: Max Distance
followActor-maxDist.tip:
Circle mode: When the distance is greater than the maximum distance, actor A will approach actor B
Rectangle mode: When the horizontal distance is greater than the maximum distance, actor A will approach actor B

followActor-offset.label: Offset Ratio
followActor-offset.tip:
If there are multiple actors following the same actor and the following distance is the same, you can set different offset ratios separately to avoid overlap
Valid range: [-0.8, 0.8]

followActor-vertDist.label: Vert Distance
followActor-vertDist.tip: When the Y-axis distance between actors is greater than the "vertical distance", actor A will approach actor B on the Y-axis

followActor-bufferDist.label: Buffer Distance
followActor-bufferDist.tip:
When the actor approaches the target, it moves slightly closer.
When the actor moves away from the target, it moves slightly farther.
This helps reduce frequent start-stop actions.

setWeight-actor.label: Actor
setWeight-actor.tip: Change the weight of this actor

setWeight-weight.label: Weight
setWeight-weight.tip:
It affects the push force during collision
When weight = 0, the actor will not collide with other actors
When the weight of actor A : the weight of actor B = 1 : 1, the movement speed of A pushing B is 50%
When the weight of actor A : the weight of actor B = 1 : 2, the movement speed of A pushing B is 0%, unable to push
When the weight of actor A : the weight of actor B = 2 : 1, the movement speed of A pushing B is 100%, there is no resistance at all
$Related command
Set Weight

setZoomFactor-zoom.tip: The zoom factor of the scene

setGameSpeed-speed.label: Speed
setGameSpeed-speed.tip: The ratio of game speed that affects the delta time of each frame

setCursor-image.label: Image
setCursor-image.tip: Set mouse pointer to this image

setTeamRelation-teamId1.label: Team A
setTeamRelation-teamId1.tip: Specify the ID of team A

setTeamRelation-teamId2.label: Team B
setTeamRelation-teamId2.tip: Specify the ID of team B

setTeamRelation-relation.label: Relation
setTeamRelation-relation.tip: Set the relation between the two teams

0.name: Enemy
0.tip: Set two teams to be hostile

1.name: Friend
1.tip: Set two teams to be friendly

enable-actor-collision.name: Enable Actor Collision
enable-actor-collision.tip: Enable the built-in actor-to-actor collision system

disable-actor-collision.name: Disable Actor Collision
disable-actor-collision.tip: Disable the built-in actor-to-actor collision system

enable-scene-collision.name: Enable Scene Collision
enable-scene-collision.tip: Enable the built-in actor-to-scene collision system

disable-scene-collision.name: Disable Scene Collision
disable-scene-collision.tip: Disable the built-in actor-to-scene collision system

save.name: Save
save.tip:
Save the current game data to the save file at the specified index
You can also save some simple local variables (boolean, number, string) in the current event
Automatically read them when reading each save data by the "For Each" command into local variables of the same name

load.name: Load
load.tip: Read game data from the save file at the specified index

delete.name: Delete
delete.tip: Delete the save file of the specified index

gameData-index.label: Save Index
gameData-index.tip: The number of the save file, corresponding to the number in the file name

gameData-variables.label: Save Variables
gameData-variables.tip:
Save some simple local variables (boolean, number, string) in the current event
Automatically read them when reading each save data by the "For Each" command into local variables of the same name

click.name: Click
click.tip: Simulate the press and release behavior of the specified key

press.name: Press
press.tip: If the specified key is released, simulate the press behavior and trigger the "Key Down" event

release.name: Release
release.tip: If the specified key is pressed, simulate the release behavior and trigger the "Key Up" event

simulateKey-keycode.label: Key Code
simulateKey-keycode.tip: Press any key to enter the key code

setLanguage-language.label: Language
setLanguage-language.tip: Switch to this language and refresh localized content (after deployment, the language settings will be automatically saved when exiting the game)

setResolution-width.label: Width
setResolution-width.tip: The actual width of the game canvas, which is automatically scaled by the window size (automatically saved after deployment)

setResolution-height.label: Height
setResolution-height.tip: The actual height of the game canvas, which is automatically scaled by the window size (automatically saved after deployment)

setResolution-sceneScale.label: Scene Scale
setResolution-sceneScale.tip: Display scene objects proportionally (automatically saved after deployment)

setResolution-uiScale.label: UI Scale
setResolution-uiScale.tip: Display UI elements proportionally (automatically saved after deployment)
